description.value:
Magical gem; intaglio; dark green jasper; engraved on side A.

Side A: Harpocrates sitting to right on lotus with knees drawn up. A snake is coiling around the lotus stalk; under the flower two smaller stalks with buds. Baseline indicating primeval mound? Horusâ left hand raised to his mouth, his right holds a flail. A long side-lock of youth is falling to his neck, on the top of his head the double crown of Egypt.
Side B: Inscribed in two lines.

description.value:
Magical gem; intaglio; emerald; engraved on side A.

Side A: Isis and Harpocrates standing in three-quarter view on a falcon-headed crocodile, the heads facing right. Isis is wearing a long garment, on her head the Isis-crown and peruke. She is holding a snake, Chnoumis, in her outstreched left hand and leading her son with her right. Harpocrates is looking at his mother, he is wearing the double crown of Egypt on his head. Around, in the free space: inscription and characters in two lines. Inscriptions on the left, beginning at the bottom and on the right, beginning at the top.
Side B: Ithyphallic, man-like cynocephalus standing to left on a globe, wearing mantle and holding a kerykeion in his right (Hermanubis). The left hand is missing. Under the kerykeion a scorpion.

description.value:
Magical gem in form of a stamp seal; haematite; perforated and threaded with gold(?) suspension-ring.

B: High, conical reverse, drilled through, with a modern wire. Plain.

description.value:
Magical gem; intaglio; lapis lazuli; engraved on side A.

Side A: Bes-Pantheos fragment: upper body of the deity with two pairs of wings and arms. Lower arms beside the body, upper arms holding standards and cobras, in the right hand: an axe, in the left hand: a scorpion, around the middle of the left arm: was-scepter. Face is masked, with four animal protomes on each side, on the head: atef-crown with sun disk, uraei and ramâs horns. To the left and right of the crown: eyes.
Side B: Inscription in five lines.

description.value:
Leather manuscript, once folded, bearing 5 lines of text and characters.

It is a small, complete sheet of leather, probably sheepskin. Probably a finished product, an amulet possibly concerned with repelling the evil eye. (The short and broad format compared with the rest of the formularies point in this direction)

description.value:
Leather manuscript containing spell to gather (business?) and for menstrual flow
More precisely, it consists of the bottom of a tall, very narrow manuscript, with remains of no fewer than two recipes: a long invocation for commercial purpose (most of the front of the fragment), and a recipe whose rubric mentions a woman and blood (meaning unclear, could be both aggressive and healing ritual)

The leather (sheep)bears imperfections from the animal's lifetime. It was cut in line with the backbone, top of the manuscript closest to the head. Probably an offcut piece

description.value: Manuscript page; painting of a deity/angel blowing a trumpet, from the the ?Aja'ib al-Makhluqat of al-Qazvini.  Enlarged title appears directly under angel, but refers to next section of text, while six additional lines of text appear underneath. Text on verso refers to Israfil blowing his horn on the Day of Judgement  Opaque watercolour and ink on paper.

description.value:
Leather manuscript written in Coptic.

Formulary on a tall, narrow sheet of tanned leather with a single recipe, an invocation for erotic magic to be used by a man upon a woman.

The sheep or goat skin sheet was cut from the lower left quarter of the animal, covering the left flank and part of the right, with the bottom of the manuscript orientated towords the head.

description.value:
Leather manuscript written in Coptic and containing magical spells for sex and business.

The fragment is from the top of a tall, very narrow sheet of sheepskin leather: it gives recipes for at least two procedures from a formulary, both concerned with favour. One is of erotic kind (in the compulsion of a woman to come and submit to a male user), one of commercial kind (attracting costumers to a place of business).

description.value:
Leather manuscript containing magical recipes written in Coptic.

Formulary on a tall, thin opisthographic tanned leather sheet with 26 recipes for invocations of angelic powers, short iatromagical recipes, combining pharmacology with inscription of ritual signs and a multi-purpose prayer with a list of various application.

The leather sheet was cut from the left flank of a calf or young bovine in line with the backbone of the animal with the top of the manuscript orientated towords the head.

description.value: Egyptian terracotta figure or fitting fragment in the form of a comedy or Silenus mask. Possibly a model of an actors dramatic mask of a Satyr with a full beard, furrowed forehead, bald head and large eyebrows, probably associated with the New Comedy. Finished edges, but missing part of beard. Pressed into a one-piece mould. Red-brown Nile silt. Traces of white lime wash.

description.value: A complete large dark brown, almost black, woven mat made of human hair. The weave is plain, balenced and open. The hair yarns are twisted in 's'-direction. The selvedges are reinforced and both of the edges have fringes. At the starting border pairs of closed loops 30mm long are 'z'-plied and tied in knots at the edge of the weave. At the ending border, groups of eight warps area 'z'-plied and knotted at the end to form a fringe 50mm long . The warp thread count is 6 per 10mm. The weft thread count is 7 per 10mm. Overall view.

description.value: A complete dark brown, woven mat made of human hair. The weave is plain, half-basket and fairly open. The hair yarns are 's'-spun. One selvedge is reinforced wth two paired warps. The other selvedge is plain with two paired warps. Both edges are finished with 's'-twisted warp cords. The warp thread count is 4 per 10mm. The weft is used in pairs and its thread count is 5 pairs per 10mm. A coarse darn 130 x 100mm is located in the centre of the mat. It measures 130x100mm and is made of mixed light and dark fibres, possibly goat hair and/or human hair. The thread is 's'-spun coarse hair.Overall shot, before conservation. May 2007.
